thought.author: Reid Hoffman
description: World-class experts build networks which help them to navigate the world. Today's #ThoughtsOnProgramming features LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman with his take on "why relationships matter".
thought.quote: No matter how brilliant your mind or strategy, if youâ€™re playing a solo game, youâ€™ll always lose out to a team.

thought.author: Linus Torvalds
description: Happy Monday Everybody ðŸŽ‰, today's #ThoughtsOnProgramming features Mr. #LinuxKernel Linus Torvalds with a controversial quote on GNOME's lack of usability back in the early 2000s when the project decided to remove a couple of features to provide an enhanced base user experience.
You can find this highly entertaining morning reading here.
thought.quote: If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.

thought.author: Martin Fowler
description: In a professional environment, the ratio of time spent reading versus writing code is about 10 to 1. Producing clean, comprehensive and maintainable code is of utmost importance and leads to increased team effectiveness. Here's nice quote from Thought Works Martin Fowler which sums it up quite nicely.
thought.quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
